Package depgraph.GraphWriter

Class GraphWriter

java.lang.Object
depgraph.GraphWriter.GraphWriter
public class GraphWriter
extends java.lang.Object
Class to read templates and create the module based dependency graph in the DOT language. This can be renered by dot (program) afterwards to create the desired image. There are three templates that this class uses called graph.temp, subgraph-inner.temp, and subgraph-outter.temp. These templates specifiy the syntax and styles that are wanted in the resulting image with some special tokens that this class replaces with the proper definitions while creating the final graph. List of all special tokens handled by this class:
  • %graph.subgraph_cluster% - clusters of subgraphs to render in that specific spot in the graph (note that this is the combination of the inner and outter most subgraphs)
  • %graph.edge_defs% - series of edge definitions (see DOT grammar)
  • %subgraph.visibility% - visibility of the function nodes in the subgraph (e.g. public or private)
  • %subgraph.modulePrefix% - shorthand version of the module name (e.g. ADC, BAL, BMS, etc.)
  • %subgraph.node_defs% - definition of every node in the subgraph
  • %subgraph.node_clusters% - the public/private graphs that contain the actual function nodes (assembled from subgraph-inner.temp)
TODO the writeGraph functions are supposed to throw Exceptions when there is an error creating the graph(s). This is currently not implemented.

  • Field Details

    • graphTemplatePath

      private java.lang.String graphTemplatePath
      Configurable path to the graph template. Called "graph.temp" by default.

    • outterSubgraphTemplatePath

      private java.lang.String outterSubgraphTemplatePath
      Configurable path to the outter-most subgraph template. Called "subgraph-outter.temp" by default.

    • innerSubgraphTemplatePath

      private java.lang.String innerSubgraphTemplatePath
      Configurable path to inner-most subgraph template. Called "subgraph-inner.temp" by default.

    • graphTemplate

      private java.lang.String graphTemplate
      Contents of the graph template file for reference throughout the class.

    • outterSubgraphTemplate

      private java.lang.String outterSubgraphTemplate
      Contents of the outter-most subgraph template file for reference throughout the class. Refer to test/example/bms-bal-cnt-example.dot for the rationale on why there is an inner and outter subgraph template.

    • innerSubgraphTemplate

      private java.lang.String innerSubgraphTemplate
      Contents of teh inner-most subgraph template file for reference throughout the class. Refer the test/example/bms-bal-cnt-example.dot for the retaionale on why there is an inner and outter subgraph template.

    • edges

      private java.util.List<Edge> edges
      List of edges created by the Parser class. Needed when creating the connections between nodes and modules in the dependency graph.

    • modules

      private java.util.List<Module> modules
      List of modules created by the Parser class. Needed when creating the representation of modules in the dependency graph.

  • Constructor Details

    • GraphWriter

      public GraphWriter()
      No-arg constructor

    • GraphWriter

      public GraphWriter​(java.util.List<Module> modules, java.util.List<Edge> edges)
      Construct a GraphWriter with predefined modules and edges.
      Parameters:
      modules - List of modules (created and passed from the Parser class)
      edges - List of edges (created and passed from the Parser class)

  • Method Details

    • readTemplates

      public void readTemplates()
      Reads graph and subgraph templates from the graphTemplatePath and subgraphTemplatePath. By default, these are set to "templates/graph.temp" and "templates/subgraph.temp"

    • writeGraph

      public void writeGraph() throws java.lang.Exception
      Draws graph with a default name.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - when there is an error creating the output file.

    • writeGraph

      public void writeGraph​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.lang.Exception
      Core function to build and write the rearranged graph. This function gets/creates all relevant definitions in the graph such as the node, edge, graph, and subgraph definitions, then arranges them in the proper order and writes the graph to a file with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file to write to.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If there is an error creating the graph or writing it to a file.

    • createNodeDefString

      private java.lang.String createNodeDefString​(Edge edge)
      Helper function to consistently create a node defintion with a guarantee of correct syntax.

      Note: There may be bugs with nodes being rendered outside of modules, because the DOT grammar says to use node_ids in edge definitions, they are used here as well. When a node is rendered in the wrong spot it tends to show up with no label and so, instead, will have a default label of the node_id (usually something along the lines of "Node#").

      To help with debugging change edge.getSourceNodeId() and edge.getDestinationNodeId() to edge.getSourceNodeObject().getNodeLabel() and edge.getDestinationNodeObject().getNodeLabel(), respectively.
      Parameters:
      edge - Edge object to create a node definition from.
      Returns:
      String representation of an edge definition according to the DOT grammar.

    • getInnerSubgraph

      private java.lang.String getInnerSubgraph​(Module module)
      Assembles the inner subgraph into its public and private function boxes.
      Parameters:
      module - Module object to separate into public/private function nodes and node_defs.
      Returns:
      String representation of the public/private functions in a module. Note that these are concatenated on return.

    • createNodeString

      private java.lang.String createNodeString​(Node node)
      Helper function to consistently create a node definition from a Node object.
      Parameters:
      node - Node object to create a node definition based on.
      Returns:
      String representation of the node according to the DOT grammar.

    • createInnerSubgraphString

      private java.lang.String createInnerSubgraphString​(Module module, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nodeDefs, boolean isPublic)
      Helper function to generalize the process of assembling the inner-most part of the subgraph.
      Parameters:
      module - Module to assemble into subgraphs.
      nodeDefs - Node definitions (created before with help from the createNodeString function) to assemble into the subgraph.
      isPublic - Boolean representing whether the passed functions are public or private.
      Returns:
      String representation of the inner-most subgraph according to the DOT grammar.

    • writeToFile

      private void writeToFile​(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String graph)
      Helper function to write the resulting graph to a file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file to write.
      graph - Graph to write to the file.

    • readTemplate

      private java.lang.String readTemplate​(java.lang.String templatePath)
      Reads template from templatePath and returns the resulting string. File is read character-by-character, so the string will be an exact copy (including whitespace).
      Parameters:
      templatePath - Path to the specific template to read.
      Returns:
      Contents of the template file.
